definition.en: Acne is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells, leading to pimples, blackheads, and whiteheads. It commonly affects teenagers but can occur at any age.

causes: Hair follicles clogged by oil and dead skin cells
Diet high in refined carbohydrates or dairy products
prevention: Wash face twice daily with gentle cleanser
Avoid touching face with dirty hands
Maintain balanced diet low in processed foods
Manage stress through exercise and relaxation
Stay hydrated (8 glasses of water daily)

mild.description: Few comedones (blackheads/whiteheads) with occasional small pimples

moderate.description: Multiple papules and pustules, increased inflammation and redness

severe.description: Nodules, cysts, widespread inflammation, risk of scarring
options: Hormonal therapy for women (spironolactone, birth control)
Drainage and surgical excision of large cysts

whenToSeeDermatologist: Acne doesn't improve after 6-8 weeks of self-treatment
Severe acne with painful cysts or nodules
Sudden onset of severe acne in adults
Acne accompanied by other symptoms (irregular periods, excess hair growth)

statistics.adultAcne: 50% of women in their 20s and 25% in their 40s
statistics.improvementTime: 6-8 weeks for visible improvement with consistent treatment

myths.myth: Acne is caused by dirty skin
myths.fact: Acne is caused by oil production, dead skin cells, and bacteria - not dirt. Over-washing can actually worsen acne.

myths.myth: Popping pimples helps them heal faster
myths.fact: Popping pimples can push bacteria deeper, cause scarring, and spread infection to other areas.
Adult acne is common, affecting 50% of women in their 20s and 25% in their 40s.
While sun may temporarily dry out acne, UV damage worsens inflammation and can cause dark spots and premature aging.
